physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Slight facial dysmorphism, height in the 32nd percentile, weight in the 33rd percentile, white plaque with shallow ulceration on the tongue, soft and nondistended abdomen, palpable spleen three fingerbreadths below the left costal margin, no hepatomegaly.

Splenomegaly confirmed by ultrasonography (14.8 cm), heterogeneous echotexture in the liver, with multiple hypoechoic nodules, normal hepatopetal flow in the portal and splenic veins, and absence of splenic or gastroesophageal varices or ascites.
Lower platelet count over time (93,000 mm3) and mild splenomegaly noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive splenomegaly and thrombocytopenia consistent with hypersplenism.
